job_title: Public Health Specialist III in Albany, NY
pros: Easy job, could easily do certificates/school on the side working here
cons: not a lot of work, zero room for advancement. Company will post a a position with the exact responsibilities as yours with higher salary, but will not offer you the position because they want more employees. they dont want to dvance your career. you are just a number here, ultimately what you do doesn't matter. and if you think working here gets you a foot in the door at the DOH you are very wrong. time in grade at HRI does not transfer to DOH jobs, and jobs as DOH are not open to HRI employees. You'd have to basically start at the bottom if you want an in at the DOH, even if you spent 5 years at HRI Oh, and the pay is ABYSMAL

job_title: Eligibility Determination Specialist in Menands, NY
pros: Don't have to work weekends
cons: The specific department this review is about is the Uninsured Care Program. Employees are overworked and underpaid. The office is micromanaged and the management has no regard for their employees. They ask for suggestions for improvement but do nothing that was suggested. Instead, they come up with their own plan without discussing it with the employees who actually do the work. There is a lot of turn-around and it is a very negative workenvironment.

job_title: Human Resources Associate in Albany, NY
pros: Good coworkers - nice office environment
cons: Grant funded, not others to add

review_title: Really low pay no career opportunities
pros: The coworkers can be nice.
cons: Low pay, horrible cost of living increases and management actively suppresses people from gaining career advancement opportunities. It’s all grant funded and therefore tethered to academic pay rates. HRI HR doesn’t standup for employees when NYSDOH managers are professionally abusive.

cons: promotions are non-existent. supervisors create toxic work environments and refuse to provide employees incentive to remain in current positions

review_title: Good on paper but a bad choice for those under 30 with no family
pros: Benefits; holidays; easy application process and interview process; and depending on where in the DOH you land, you learn a lot from the experience.
cons: Bureaucracy is encumbering; an old guard kind of thinking that keeps inexperienced management supporting each other; lack of a forward-thinking work culture that habitually ignores new ideas; lack of a young workforce; incredibly late adopters to policies that would help retain people (remote work for example); and expensive insurance depending on grade level.

pros: Great company to work for with an excellent work life balance.
cons: There's been no downsides to the company

pros: Good benefits and well known company

pros: They provide a cordial, respectful and healthy work environment. I worked at Roswell Park Cancer Institute, one of their division and I found the work environment a wonderful place to work in.  HRI staff are very efficient, cordial and treat you well unlike a more recent employer I worked with Leidos.  Moreover, their HR and employee benefits are very well managed and when you raise a concern with them (which I did on one occasion), they treat you with concern, give you complete confidentiality and follow up with you till your concern is resolved.   A great company to work with.
cons: Need more opportunities for career development especially at the lower levels of the ladder.  I was a researcher as a postdoc for a number of years and without the proper titles, I found it very difficult to apply for grants and get ahead.  had to leave the company to pursue better opportunities.

review_title: Rewards only for time served, not skills or actual work.
job_title: Assistant Research Scientist in Albany, NY
pros: The pension and benefits are really, really good.  You also get a lot of time off and breaks during the day.
cons: HRI employees work side-by-side with State of NY health department employees.  The atmosphere is very bad.  There is no benefit to doing good work (rewards are based only on length of employment), so people are generally unmotivated.  A lot of time and money is wasted.  Management has no control over disruptive employees, as the union protects employees.

job_title: Public Health Specialist IV in Albany, NY
pros: Good work environment,  excellent benefits room for advancement. Never a dull moment in the ever changing dynamic of State and National politics.
cons: Grant funded positions, lot's of stress due to State and Federal deadlines.  A lot of duplication of efforts because of the nature of State policy.

pros: Finding a cure for cancer is everyone's goal.  Between HRI and RPCI you cannot help but love your job.
cons: HRI positions are grant funded.  There is no job security.  If the grant is no longer funded and you are not "essential"  you are let go.  The unions cannot protect you and seniority means nothing.

pros: Benefits are the same as state benefits
cons: grant funded positions with funding being terminated often

pros: Uses new programming technologies, sponsors H1B, good company for entry level programmer,
cons: Not a good company for a senior developer, Low salaies compared to other developers in the market, non profit organization, Long wait for promotions, long wait to start Green card process, less benefits.

pros: A rather boring but otherwise ridiculously easy job.
cons: The lab that I had the misfortunate of being employed in had  members of the highest unprofessional order.  They would lie, manipulate, and fight which made for a toxic environment. Never in my life have I have been made to feel so bad for trying to learn. No growth opportunities were possible and the pay was a joke.

pros: Union Benefits - Pension, Great Time Off (50 or so days a year with vacation, sick, personal, and holiday time), Flex Schedules allow for every other friday off through compressed work schedule
cons: Union Benefits - non-negotiable salaries.

review_title: Toxic work environment - Wadsworth NYS DOH
pros: There really are no benefits to working or HRI/Wadsworth, low pay, low ethical standards, whacky administration.
cons: Corrupt administration and security personel creates a hostile work environment.  Nepotism between administration and scientific staff (married couples playing favorites).
